I had the perfect amount of time for a layover, had a great flight and a great business trip, I wasn't too concerned about the price as my meals were being covered by my clients. I smiled and tried to be friendly and she was just a grouch. I have no idea what her problem was but projecting it on me was unprofessional and just unkind.  A hostess is "paid" to be friendly. That IS their job. To kindly greet guests, warm them up for the waiter, and then find an appropriate seat.  Honestly, the server wasn't much better. She had a "mildly pissy" attitude. Not as bad as the other.  I gave this 2 stars and I'm not sure why I even gave that many. I guess 1 1/2 would be appropriate but I'm feeling generous.  I'm pretty sure that the restaurant won't contact me but I wish they would.  If you're stuck in the airport, try somewhere else.

1r_jfoptsHOVl_HyUsZ4HQ.text: Matt's Biggest Breakfast!   First time flying out of this terminal, decided to belly up to the bar here at Matt's. The gentleman beside me had three plates of food in front on him, each looked better than the burrito I was contemplating on the menu. I asked what he was having and learned it was "Matt's Biggest Breakfast". I'll have that!  A pile of scrambled real eggs, a huge pancake, fried potatoes, two sausage patties, two really thick slices of bacon with peppered edges, and I added toast.   Oh my, that wasn't only the best airport breakfast I've had, but may have been the best breakfast I've had in Phoenix.

9IEjJ2f_6JrmGf0IZN2LVA.text: You might have to wait if you visit the downtown location but no wait here. They pour a generous mimosa. Their BLT come on fresh sliced bread, with thick slices of bacon. I like to add avocado. The pancakes are perfect and served with real Vermont syrup. Great place to eat before you get on a long flight.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

YdyRzB7veCM2mwsBlVewsA.text: Airport location is not as good as the location downtown.    They get really busy here and often have a 15-20+ minute wait.  From this experience I will not return to the airport location again.

TQycm0CR3Na5TJIMLzxShw.text: They'd rather ignore you than deal with you. Don't go in anywhere close to last call. Rude bartender. Our waitress was nice- her name was Katrina I think? But the lack of communication got in the way of her doing her job.  I had a "please just let me give you my money" smile on my face, but nobody would make eye contact. Bummer.  And dear host- if it's that close to last call, don't encourage people to go in and give it a try... It's embarrassing for me as I sit and wait, and embarrassing for you when I walk out disappointed. My advice- just be nice and be honest!

ZICcWe08qCjoXNyieJtdCg.text: MBB needs to first understand this isn't 5-star fine dining and people are here because THEY ARE FLYING TODAY Unbelievable slow service in an half empty restaurant and no food after 20 minutes from ordering with waiters all standing around talking to one another   People - it's an airport - everyone has somewhere to go  - and I did- I walked out

n14fDcWmkcYWV4SapY_Vmw.text: Our flight to Newark was scheduled to leave at 9:45am this morning.  By the time we made it through security, it was 9:20... (I'm one of those people that cuts it a little too close sometimes).  I was starving though, and knew I needed to eat something prior to the five hour flight!  Luckily, Matt's came to the rescue!  I ordered a Sonrisa Burrito to-go.  It comes with eggs, cheese, jalapeno peppers, potatoes, and your choice of bacon or sausage.  I ordered mine with sausage and no potatoes.  It was a generous serving and I actually ended up splitting it with my husband.  We devoured it and agreed that it was delicious.  I would have liked some salsa to go with it though.  Next time, I'll ask for that!  I'm now writing this review on the flight and feeling good after filling my belly... If you find yourself at Sky Harbor anywhere close to Terminal 4 - B gates, Matt's is a great option.  You can eat in or take it to-go.  So glad that we have so many decent options at the PHX airport now!  Bon appetit and safe travels!

RSW9x_lpQaOe3CijiMDmZw.text: Matt's in the airport, love it. This was one of our favorite meals in Phoenix and now we can get a taste even when just passing through the city.   Great food for breakfast or lunch, fun music mix, and nice staff make this a go to spot, especially in an airport!

ZrM5ozQ6efe2tQeJiI2TzQ.text: Matt's was the perfect breakfast after a wedding the night before. The food is delicious and high quality. I loved the taste of all of the ingredients. I had the chicken sandwich and the breast meat was juicy, and paired fantastically with the pesto sauce.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

JV83mz6Elgl3lDYo0ef3eg.text: Matt's infinitesimal breakfast is pricey.  I was not very hungry so I thought I would order an egg and a little sausage with my drink.  What arrived was a tiny little patty of sausage that brought to mind that "where's the beef" commercial from the 80s.  The egg was fine and the service reasonable or this would be 1 star .  I feel cheated.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. That&#39;s a 4$ sausage patty and a 1.69$ egg.  I won&#39;t eat it, I will have it bronzed.

5M4Fr2iI_Md3qxMjQOVCRw.text: Good food, great drinks, and even better service! I had a couple lovely ladies serving me and keeping me company as I was flying alone and arrived to the airport way too early! The only thing about this place that bothered me was their god awful uniforms! Those shirts would be better worn for servicing the plane over serving me drinks.

Iu6dSK4LjlndNUkzM6qyWw.text: I love how breakfast is served 24 hours all day! It's honestly the best, and most important meal of the day. And for the airport, it was pretty good. I have pretty low expectations since it's usually average tasting but a heftier price.   The Sonrisa burrito was good, except for a couple pieces of the potatoes. Some of the pieces were tough, like they were cooked for too long. I asked for extra salsa as well...they definitely don't give enough if you're trying to pour a bit on every bite.   The hours listed on the Yelp page is incorrect. I landed around 6PM and was able to sit down and order.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sonrisa burrito

1FQtYCrbCiYDza-bYn6uUg.text: Having a little over an hour layover at PHX, we stopped in for a bite.  There is a row of high top tables down the dining area good for a group.  We had a group of 6.   A good array of breakfast entrees and sandwiches.  While it was not printed in the menu, the sandwiches must come with chips.   The server also mentioned other sides available including: fries, cole slaw or macaroni salad.   The one thing the server did not mention was the up charge for the other side options.   We were quite surprised when the check was presented.   Most in the party ordered sandwiches.   The grilled chicken sandwiches were tasty.  The tuna salad sandwich was okay.   And the egg salad sandwich was underwhelming.    The bread for all of the sandwiches was dry and a bit stale.   Being in an airport, I would think that the server would recognize that a group of 6-adults who clearly do not look like family would want separate checks.  We didn't ask, so we did not receive.

ExIRvIJLBte1-vvGExCCTA.text: Good isn't the same. Franchise run by a large company. Prices are horrendous. $30 for a Mai Tai that was mostly ice and Louis Martini cab.  (Under 10 per bottle in the store).  Breakfast staff aggressively friendly. Pm stay ok but not the same.  Airports ... What can you say?

XdMnmxbSHuV9b48XhBWExw.text: Do NOT eat here if you are even moderately in a hurry, you know, like you sometimes are in airports when you have to catch your flight. I waited at the register (2nd in line) for 10 minutes for my order to be taken. I should have left then but I was trying to be positive. After I ordered my breakfast burrito it took 20 minutes to get it. I counted 8 people in the kitchen. Not all cooks I'm sure but come on, how hard is a breakfast burrito??  I had to eat it on the plane because of how long it took and it was just meh, so all in all a huge disappointment.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

lJFXh0ovaDFegV1rw0upjw.text: Busy place, especially early a.m. Service is good. Food is okay. Daniel out server was the best, very accommodating and attentive

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Breakfast Area

hJQoN6d5KVJphiHZRBbSSA.text: Fresh strawberry spread oh my!!!!! I wish i could buy this in a jar and take it home. Amazing place and I'm always excited when my gate is B1-B14. Best breakfast in town.   Daniel V is so nice and fun. Makes our travel day start w a smile.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

l9-qoMVlYErsVObiMyn1NA.text: Just a one-time-visitor shout out!  I was waiting for my flight out of Sky Harbor and I knew I needed a little snack and a cocktail prior to boarding.  I sat at the bar (this place was PACKED at 8:30am).  The bartender could not have been sweeter, which is a great sign when you are packed to the gills and still can keep your charm up... she was great!  I ordered some sourdough toast and jam.  The toast was very homemade style, very yummy, thick and delicious!  Jam was the same, also yummy, thick and delicious.  A perfect combo.    Washed that down with an extra spicy Bloody Mary, topped with cheeses, olive, and a thick slice of crispy bacon.    I know when I'm back, I will take time to visit again.  Thanks! CHEERS!!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. 8:30 am equals Bloody Mary time at the airport!

ldnbTsBYob79OyXlXw3kNg.text: MATT'S BIG BREAKFAST did the trick while at the PHX airport. I had a burger and fries there. It was solid. Maybe the airport version is not as good as the restaurant, or maybe I should have eaten breakfast. But I'm unsure of why it was featured on DDD.   A-OK. Good for airport food. 3.5 stars.

cDVEL3bkCLsOxC56_TboEw.text: May 2, 2019 Thursday - 8 AM for Breakfast 1 adult  Atmosphere - 5 stars Food - 5 stars Service - 4 stars  Background - I knew I had a long layover, and I also knew there was a Diner, Drive-In and Dives alternate location inside Sky Harbor.  For me alternate triple D locations are where they did not film the show at this location but related to the film location.  I walked off the plane and boom there they were.  Atmosphere - A sit down relax airport restaurant.  The bar seating area was large, which is ideal for the solo traveler.  So I ended sitting there, no point of taking a two person table.  Best part of sitting at the bar is that there is an outlet either to right or left below the counter, near your knees.     Food   Drink - I had Kilt Lifter by Four Peaks Brewing Company a local brewery, which they actually have a bar in the airport too.  I gotta love how no one judges you for having a beer at 8 AM.    Breakfast - I love a good breakfast burrito and the Sonrisa caught my eye immediately.  The burrito was grilled lightly on the flat top to give a crisp toasty texture to the tortilla.  I would have like my potatoes to been a little smaller and the chorizo to be a little larger.  Just a person preference.  The chorizo was a crumble and very tasty.  The salsa had a nice smoke taste, but I found it too watery.  So it was not good for dipping my burrito so I had to pour it onto my burrito.  The burrito was cut in half and I was using my hand to hold it instead of using the real silverware fork and knife they provide.  Service - I was in an out in 30 minutes, which is what you want in an airport.  The down side of the place was they did not have a True hostess working today, or ever I do not know.  But a couple of the waiters were working the station plus my bartender from behind the bar.  My bartender seemed like a carny try to get people into the place, so that was kinda an atmosphere killer.  Future - If I have time I will be back, hopefully I can get back to the original location.

MyXMctv8BHDShrw8OpRECQ.text: Ok, so it is in AZn airport. No excuse. Slow, rosemary, too heavy, slow, way too much for much $.

mjqtJ9-l5Jt-rSl9BoZPTQ.text: This airport outpost is a sorry excuse for Matt's Big Breakfast. I really like the original location of Matt's, and this is just an embarrassment. First, the place was filthy. Dirty utensils under the table, bits of napkin all over the area. No prices on the menu for draft beer, so be warned, a draft beer is 12 ounces (even though they claim 13 ounces) and it's $9. The $5.49 order of fries were a cup of sogginess. Sandwich order came out wrong. Manager and servers said, "not my decision, write to management." So, I am now 0 and 3 with PHX restaurants run by this management company. I'm through PHX half the year, so I guess I'll start packing food.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. On left, a $9 &#34;13 ounce&#34; draft beer. On right, a 12 ounce bottled beer, poured into an identical glass. Rip off.
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. No prices on the draft beers. Bottles are, in small print, $8.50.
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mamacita burger is a sloppy mess and not good.

zwsDCf4xNAsUyHoj7Jt8ww.text: Wait time sucks. I ordered a SALAD w/ chicken 'to go' for my flight. 20 mins later salad comes a has half the ingredients as the one in the cooler.   $12.99 freshly made add $4.99 for chicken.   Manager happily said she'd get me 'more.' I just asked for more veggies & beans.   She came back with a beautiful salad, with extra veggies.   Thanks Desi!

ljLdr52v-7HAsYMeJqEYug.text: Decent spot. As always when in an airport pricing is not a rating factor. It will be at least 30% more than the outside.   Bacon is the specialty and it is really good. Had the BLT and the bacon is thick sliced and crunchy without being burned.   Service was as expected. Seating is tight, but tables and high top bar type space turn.

Z77gXzh5JbIHaB7aoFr9xw.text: Had a great breakfast here.  Had Matt's big breakfast - eggs, hash browns, bacon, sausage and pancakes.  It was very good.  The sausage was a little spicy but flavorful.  The wait staff was very kind and friendly.  There was a little wait to get in, but once the order was placed it was pretty quick getting to the table.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

M2t0cwZWeSuHdqmi0xoSzw.text: BACON IS AMAZING  And I geek out reading stories of organizations that use simple and relatable terms to convey their mission, values and core purpose. I especially like to read menus of local restaurants. Matt's Big Breakfast in Phoenix did not disappoint today and became my morning devotion and inspiration for my own work ethic. #hrlife #bebettereveryday #findinspirationanywhere  "Never compromising our ideals"  "Elevate a common (experience) to an uncommon level"

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

hSdY-Uoet7lOLBfCo5EtBw.text: This place is right by terminal 4 in PHX and one of the better places that I saw when I was walking down towards the baggage claim.   Their food takes a while to come out- it was a out 15 to 20 minutes on a Thursday at around 11:45am. Though it takes a while, it's because their food is handmade and boy, it's quite busy.   There aren't a lot of well-known food places in that terminal, so I'd definitely suggest this place. They also have a few breakfast food that you can order all day!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Big Butter Burger!

lU0wGbgpIohTBVEV57PM1w.text: This restaurant/bar at Sky Harbor, Terminal 4 is decent. The menu is diverse, the staff was extremely friendly and the food was tasty. The prices were great - and the portions were ample.  You may have to wait for a seat, but usually the wait isn't long.  The only reason I didn't give this restaurant a 5 star rating is because my potatoes/home fries were cold. The sandwich I ordered and my wife's food was perfect.  I would definitely recommend this place to family and friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The breakfast sandwich I had - I left the onions off and added avocado. It was delicious! The home fries were cold - that was a bummer.

-E6pX6xvIsHw08x9Rq48rA.text: These guys serve the best Bloody Mary drinks and the service is great. I would definitely come back here and try the steak and eggs.

4YPIPWqaEWMYY3xIHpHPcQ.text: down-home Southern-style - a cut above for airport food  I had the reuben sandwich with a side of macaroni, with the freshly-squeezed lemonade with honey. The marble rye bread on the sandwich had crust embedded with what tasted like caraway seeds, and was lightly toasted, and fresh-tasting. The pastrami is made in-house, the sign says. The meat was so-so with more fat than I expect, and the sauerkraut lacked flavor. The macaroni salad was really flavorful and I savored each bite. Now the standout for this meal was the lemonade!! I could suck down a gallon and still want more. Ironically, I was trying to avoid excess sugar, and though the sign claims that there's no added sugar, they do add a LOT of honey, which does contain tons of natural sugar, though sugar is sugar, and as addictive as cocaine and heroin, I keep reading in my holistic health blogs. That comes as no surprise.   I'd love to write more, but I am way behind on everything. Anyway, what a buzzkill I can "bee". Get the lemonade here, and enjoy life! Airports are really hard to be in, with all the waiting and the loud jarring noises, abominable behaviors right and left, and being WAAAAYYYYY to close for comfort to everyone in all those hellhole godawful tightly crowded stinky nasty airplanes (I don't fly first class - I'm so middle-class I can't bear to part with extra money for a few hours of a little more leg room and I don't need free cheap headache booze and used dirty blankets), so soothe yourself by eating what makes you happy, then exercise like crazy later.  What's not clear at all is that if you order at the counter, you take your food to go and you are supposed to eat it elsewhere, like at your gate, not in the restaurant, I later found out. Well, I committed a faux pas, unknowingly, and sat in the restaurant at a table right behind the counter where I placed my order. I apologized to the waiter who came by, and I asked if I should move, but he was gracious, and let me stay.   The other menu items, like the cheeseburger, looked really tempting.   People were enjoying themselves with beers, watching the futbol/soccer highlights reel at the bar.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Danx183U2oP1IG2M4EOPmw.text: Pretty basic as for food goes. Typical airport food - low quality and greasy. I had the Mamacita Burger with side of cole slaw and the Four Peaks Hop Knot. The beer was good, the burger - not so much.  Burger lacked flavor, seasoning and was not cooked properly. The cole slaw was disgusting and the pickle (how can you go wrong) was terrible. I love pickles but after one bite, no thank you! Oh, and the waitress never informed me that the cole slaw would be an extra $3.49 to my bill. I'll opt for a Wendy's burger that's 2 stalls down instead - they have better quality and better value.  I'm giving this place 2 stars because the beer was that good.

tCs2PmyIZFXk_aARxWquAQ.text: If you want a healthy hearty salad order the  healthy salad with grilled chicken. Outstanding quality. Great service. Our server had a very short haircut with pretty eyes. I did not get her name but she was so kind.

IGuBNM6YVzEgNBRNctWOmQ.text: Good service every time.  Paul is great bartender!  Amazing bacon Bloody Mary .  See you guys next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

c23D5e0fPWoZaqpFf0JGhA.text: Matthew was my server and he was fantastic!  He was prompt, efficient, friendly, and got my order right!  He was working a number of tables and I was quite impressed watching him maneuver and ensure everyone was cared for.  The restaurant is in Terminal 4 so quite busy but they seemed to be turning the tables well.  I had just a couple minute wait but they also have an express option - takeout area - for those that don't have time.  I had an omelet that was very good.  The restaurant itself is clean and comfortable.  The hostess was friendly as was the person that delivered my food.  Good experience all around - which I certainly appreciate when in the midst of airport hustle/bustle.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

mE0junIx23gvvsmL85sjVg.text: Airport food. Let's keep it simple. The greeter was super nice. The server was super nice. The bartender was super nice. The food came out fast hot. The drinks came out quick and were delicious. And the food....probably some of the best airport food I have ever had. Better than some regular restaurants. And I always expect less of airport food. I was pleasantly surprised. I travel through Phoenix often...will definitely stop by here if I have time. And so should you . ;)

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cheese omelette. Looks plain, but pretty tasty inside that omelette. Potatoes?! Damn good!

OAVKA_AiMT_jBL27aBeQxA.text: If you are looking for a tasty Bloody on your way out of town for vacation or a Egg White & Spinach omelet before heading off for a business trip, this place won't disappoint.

L9oUK6MooEPLz0i4r69Hzg.text: Passed through here with enough time for a sit down lunch...had the Hog and Chick with ham steak (plus an extra ham steak because it is just that good)  It is honestly almost coming to the Phoenix airport just to hit Matts.  I don't like potatoes usually but I will clean the plate with Matts potatoes, just the right amount of fresh rosemary and onion.  Great sourdough toast, delicious raspberry jam.    And the ham!   Just please do yourself a favor and get the ham.  This is what you think about when you think ham, salty, smoky, crisp and soft all at the same time.  Can't wait to fly through terminal four again.

T1Dh3UXO84ZBzCKUGzeWrA.text: Why do I punish myself. I had an hour before my flight so I gave them another shot.  Seriously, what takes so long to cook 2 eggs?  After 25 minutes and 2 server apologies later my order arrived with bacon instead of sausage. I grabbed the plate and said "i don't have time for you to fix it". They brought me sausage. Right away. Hey they can cook some things fast.  Just a mistake to stop here at the airport before your flight. Give yourself more than an hour.

vWde1pd9YigQLpMsCMnUfQ.text: As a person that travels for a living I've had my share of bad airport food but this place makes up for all of it. Excellent food, fresh, plentiful and great service. I will make it a point to visit them again and I bookmarked the main restaurant in the city.  The waffles were perfect and the Reuben was too.  Don't hesitate to visit them when you're at the Phoenix airport.

Dew_EtsjyDlrNAsMUtAtzQ.text: Such a surprise to find wonderful food at an airport! The homemade strawberry jam is the best! The sourdough toast is thick and delicious. The staff is great. Cannot day enough good about this place. Will come here anytime I am at Sky Harbor!

Emc6AQ6UzwKVaiQpMn7T-w.text: Two visits a row = very disappointing  Twice now the eggs over medium are runny - I guess when you ask for the whites to be cooked through it doesn't matter; toast not toasted?? What's up Matt??  I don't want you to "take care of my breakfast" I simply want to enjoy a good breakfast before my flight, and I'm happy to take care of the bill.

G2rkNVTY8LharmOQ5lDBAg.text: Was sat quickly, table was clean and waitress was quick and friendly. I decided to order the meatloaf because the waitress said it was yummy and she was right! The meatloaf was grilled on both sides to have a crisp carmellization. The mashed potatoes were delicious with a great grace and the side asparagus was perfect! I will definitely be back. Thank you!

viNFhQuh4XpPjx1HFSNx8Q.text: This place has the worst oatmeal in the airport--no fruit, no nuts and a meagre amount of raisins and their oatmeal costs $1 more than anywhere else in the entire airport.  Better to get your oatmeal from La Madeleine, Starbucks, or Wildflower--all with fresh fruit and nuts.

--8tPZwxEWrQGV32NkAcqg.text: Sit down breakfast options are super limited in the Phoenix airport and Matt's in generally packed.  I ordered the salami scramble and fresh juice that was pretty good.  Service was okay.  Nothing spectaular, nothing terrible.  OK option if you're not in a big hurry.

aHf8SF8HEbPDqsBEyVQExw.text: Foods great. Bartender...not so much. Poor attitude and rude. Stay in the main terminal.

JPQCT2r6kNuvKbikej0fOg.text: When you've been traveling since 3 am, you just want to stop for a big breakfast and coffee. Luckily, my gate was a mere 30 second walk from Matt's, giving me plenty of time to enjoy a "Matt's big breakfast" with pancakes, eggs, bacon, and sausage. The bacon here is peppered, thick, and delicious. The rest of the breakfast measured up just as well. They also have a full bar in case you aren't traveling at breakfast time and have other menu items as well. Overall, I'm pleased that this was an option in my terminal.

M72rSGNk7PlMa22VTZE9jg.text: Great, great spot to wait for your plane if you're in Terminal 4. When I went to Phoenix ages ago (and ate carbs with no abandon), this was my favorite place in Phoenix!  Now that I don't enjoy the pancakes or the hash browns, I am still glad to post up at Matt's, enjoy some of their delicious peppered bacon, grab a drink (or a few), have great service, and listen to good music while sitting in an airport.  Thanks Matt's!

UP7Mpwh2C46PCeGrUcsbhg.text: Ordered the smothered and covered.  The food came out nasty and covered in cold gravy!  WTF!  The food was cold.  The ideas was great, the flavors reminded me of Hamburger Steak with gravy back home in Hawaii.  Also, if you ask for hot sauce, specifically Tabasco, they only have Tapatio!  WTF, cheap hot sauce.  Luckily j brought my own Tabasco sauce to the party!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

ZvE7ZT6DuMLyp7ksoMGAJw.text: Solid breakfast!  I've been here four times while waiting for my connecting flights and have always ordered the Matt's Biggest Breakfast - 2 sausage patties, 2 strips of thick-cut bacon, eggs, potatoes and a pancake.  Wow, this meal is solid!  Everything is flavorful and fresh!  They have real maple syrup and ketchup without high fructose corn syrup - another plus!  My husband has ventured to try other menu items and they never disappoint.  The service has always been great and fast, which is needed, especially in an airport.  I highly recommend a stop here if you happen to find yourself at the Phoenix airport - Gate B!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Matt&#39;s biggest breakfast! Delicious!

ch9WtThJhc63_Y8m2J4U3Q.text: I've eaten here about 3-4 times and for whatever reason the staff seems annoyed that they are here, distracted and almost rude.   I've eaten breakfast at Matts downtown PHX and the experience and frankly quality of food is much better.   Ordered Matts Big Breakfast: bacon was cold, sausage was undercooked and the eggs I ordered over medium were also under cooked.   Whole experience was disappointing.

WCcfOCUkAQMNaDWdc3G1oA.text: No greeters! No hostess! Full place and looks like one server for 100 people and 2 bartenders!! Had to seat ourselves at a dirty table and waited for any kind of attention for 5 minutes and then took off!! Nice job Manager!!!

_PNxS9gwKwvKdBL30_ca-g.text: This place is amazing organic local food small business ! They have the same prices as the place they have in town. Hogs and chicks are awesome with peppered bacon the sausage is amazing too. If you order with someone else get one of each so you can share and get both. By far the best dining experience I have had at an airport . Our waiter TIM was outstanding and a great asset to Matt's Big Breakfast! Way to go Phoenix AirPort for allowing local business!! If you go here comment and tell me what you think. Oh ya cheap too $

0bZr0c59JncvkGVfcuNqjQ.text: So as I strolled through the Phoenix Airport I moved passed the regular fast food breakfast fare and came across Matt's Big Breakfast and thought "this is the place."  The tables were packed and the "to go" line seemed to be moving quickly.  I checked my phone (25-30 minutes to boarding STARTED), read over the menu (Breakfast Burrito for the win) and got in line.    The young guy working as very nice despite the fact he was obviously SLAMMED.  I should've taken the clue that 1 guy taking all the orders, pouring all the coffee, and having to run around the bar to pick up the to go food was a harbinger of issues to come, but I forged on.  He took my name and gave me my receipt.  As time continued to pass I started forgetting who ordered what and when and I noticed the crowd outside of the restaurant continued to grow, and grow, and grow.  It was cool though, I still had 20 minutes left.  Around the 25 minutes of waiting mark I figured it was time to see if I was close.  As I waited in the line AGAIN, to check the status of my food, I noticed that 3 of the 7 people in the line were doing the same thing.  I reached the front, informed the clerk that I NEEDED my food because I'd waited 30 minutes and my plane was boarding soon.  He informed me my food was up soon.  I waited about 7-8 more minutes after that and was handed my burrito.  No bag, no napkin.  Just the burrito.  As I ran off I overheard another lady requesting a refund because she couldn't wait for her food anymore.  Once I finally boarded my plane (and had to check my bag because I was one of the last 5 people to enter it), I was ready to eat.  The burrito itself was "meh" at best.  The standout was the bacon, it was amazing and it was obviously this wasn't some low cost meat, I found myself wishing the rest of the burrito emulated this taste.  It didn't.  The eggs had next to no flavor and were oily, and I'm about 90% sure the potatoes were cooked in some form of olive oil as well, because that's the only taste they had.    Overall, I wished I had as great an experience as everyone else who sat down, ate and reviewed, however I wasn't so lucky.  Beyond having a friendly person, the express counter was a joke (40 minutes, that's good right?) and the burrito beyond the bacon completely lacked flavor.  Maybe it was just a bad day I attended, but I don't know if I'll roll the dice again.  If you go, make sure you have an hour plus and skip the burrito.

tvvMid_dMwPEptEaflddcA.text: Just had breakfast prior to my flight. This location not as good as original in downtown Phoenix. Matt needs to oversee more.

bYd8zyOf_MDJJo64mvgIUg.text: Probably just a bad night for them, but I interacted with 3 employees and all were short and rude and Uninterested.  I had to ask for a menu, ask if I could order a beer, and when I asked if they have chips and salsa the bartender said "no" and walked away. Nuthin. Then couldn't get them to process my payment for 10 minutes. The exception was Karina, a waitress who was friendly. The only smile over a 25 minute period.

ShNJ_MnZE7O9XfIfUrgZLQ.text: Worst service I've ever had. Matt was there and he didn't even talk to people, he seems like he doesn't care. I am all for supporting local businesses because they show they care but he didn't. Food is overrated, I heard it was the best but it's comparable to Denny's.

hOHp6DWRo0r5srTWVddHwQ.text: Beware food may be unsafe!!  Three of us ate here yesterday.   Service was fine, but we were sick all last night and today.  100+ temperatures.  Clearly food poisoning.  They should have their cleanliness and food preparation checked.

9EJ6C6-OHxiFjpAKJRSkZA.text: Could not be better in any way!  Service was very fast and the food is amazing.  The bacon was very thick and fresh, potatoes were perfect and had some fresh rosemary in them. This is the best toast I have ever had, nice and thick with a nice homemade jam.  I hope I'm at the B gates on terminal 4 again soon to get a meal here! So good!

CHqT0jmIISiHbkoik7lpsg.text: My wife and I had an awful 13 hour lay over in Phoenix. We arrived around 8 pm and our flight wasn't until 10 am the next morning. The original plan was to eat a good dinner and try to fall asleep... Unfortunately our plan didn't work out.   We didn't get our bags until about 845 and all the restaurants were closed, so we scarfed down a pizza. Around 2 am I was searching on Yelp for some good breakfast.   I got the steak and eggs and it was cooked to perfection. Most steak and eggs are overly cooked but this steak was JUICY. My wife got a waffle with bacon. The waffle was so fluffy and had just about enough sweetness. The bacon here is also amazing. Never had bacon like this before. It was a thicker cut and seasoned with pepper. She also got a mimosa and I got a Bloody Mary. Both were really good. Thanks Matt's Big Breakfast for making this long lay over enjoyable.

5ty8oh1pHTyC0-ysosyaLA.text: Really good breakfasts. Our waiter, Michael was hilarious and upbeat. He made the whole meal fun. The food was very good. I'd eat here if it was outside the airport. It's obviously more expensive than an outside restaurant, but even taking that into consideration, very good food. It cost us about $50 for four to eat breakfast. A normal breakfast enter is too big. It would be safe to order one breakfast and split it.

vvkLdjo_6H5kDpDZA91Irg.text: Horrible, horrible service. I am a big fan of the original Matt's, but this is a poor set up for an airport. When you order to-go food, they ask your name (sometimes) and then sometimes call out names or the type of food it is. I waited 25 minutes for my breakfast burrito (first off, who has that much time in an airport) to then be told it wasn't mine because she took my name. So I waited and waited. And no one took the burrito. So I went back to ask nicely if perhaps that was mine and she yelled at me and told me now. I waited and waited again (now the burrito is cold) and asked if it was possible she forgot to type in my name. She angrily grabbed my receipt and checked the times. "Oh I guess it's yours, sorry". So now I've paid $10 for a cold burrito that i waited 35 minutes for. No thanks. Will never come again.

xJ0FJaK3PaUWF-w1sxUEjg.text: The food is very good but the wait is long at certain times of the day. Still worth it.

WpACjWYWtgKBnqbnjh3x6Q.text: I just needed to get something to eat before my connecting flight. Lucky to find this place. Good food and really friendly staff. Made me feel like I was at a local hangout.

xGVYNy0MXAs8YidCDfYPTw.text: Food was great! Had a wonderful breakfast. Highly recommend!!!  Organic and local food. Bacon was so thick and well cooked. The whole grain bread was great, with a homemade jelly. I am a picky eater, but this food was quality!!

eZtG7avPimC-Bf-wflMLEA.text: Cannot overstate what a great experience this was. Gotta start with the food: my griddle cakes were amazing and my wife's waffle was just about as good. Delicious thick slab, peppered bacon was the perfect side. Coffee was not as good as the food (always the conundrum-give up coffee shop quality for better food?), but at least plentiful. Service was beyond friendly, though marred by lacking silverware after our food was served (thankfully, the butter still melted). Probably the best airport dining experience I ever had. Hope our connection next week allows time for a return engagement.

_jIK2qpjhns3CiFz2GOqrQ.text: Great food!! Everything tastes great and was truly fresh as advertised. I got here early enough to not have to brave the long line out front (although knowing what I know now I would have happily done it). The eggs were fresh, the bacon looked and tasted like real bacon, the waffle was fluffy and delicious and the orange juice which came out of a gigantic plastic jar I'm sure was squeezed that morning. A+

E64s70YSJ2LSV63vr6qGkw.text: Ask your server what's good. I'll give you a hint, *ANYTHING* with the word  "salad" in it is a dud. Not because I don't like salad, I LOVE salads! But the fancy salad, tossed "cobb" salad, egg salad sandwich, tuna salad sandwich, and macaroni salad are all VERY bland. Trust me on this one. And the tomato soup tastes like maranara sauce, but is super good for dipping the awesome grilled cheese into. Tomato soup by itself....meh. Plus....it's $7 DOLLARS for one bowl of tomato soup. No. Everything else is well worth the money. If you have any issues with your food ever, just let your server know (nicely) and they'll gladly fix it for you, seriously. Also...they don't carry ranch. WHAT!?!?! In America?????? Lame. But all their food is seriously thebomb. com, and I suggest you get with your server to help you choose. they're usually WAY busy,  but most of the time very friendly and willing to give you an honest opinion.   Personally, I recommend the Sweet N Savory french toast. WOW. And that applewood smoked pork sausage???? WWWWOWWWW

4Je75OVd0-TPuWCLbqFx6w.text: Food was good, phenomenal if you consider the fact it's airport food, and the service was quick, I had mine 10 minutes after I sat down. Toni was very attentive and made sure I had everything I needed when I wanted it. The quality is not quite on par with the downtown location, but it is defiantly above the rest for PHX.

iTy69f5uHEzypQVhFPupfA.text: This absolutely the best and most reasonable airport food around!!  Had the omelet with mushrooms, peppers and bacon - done to perfection!!

IgoLclMhNJFZTPO0z8dYaQ.text: Matt's, not just for breakfast! 10 of us gals, (yes 10) rolled into Matt's for one last drink (after draining Costco's wine section for 5 days straight) and a bite to eat before boarding our flight home. While this is one of the nicest Airport restaurants I've eaten in, and the food (when it finally arrived) was quite good, there were just way too many snafus for me to give them more then 3 stars.   To start, 3 of us got there before the others - thank you priority check-in! So we ordered a good 15 minutes before the rest of the group. Needless to say, after 45mins, watching the rest of the group get their meals, and finish, we still had not got our meals. Everyone shared, so I can tell you the Cobb salad, super good as are the fries. Now after trying to ask our waitress, a few times, to find out what happened to our meals, she kept saying the kitchen was busy and it will come when it comes... We all knew this was not right, no matter how busy a kitchen is, food ordered first, comes first if it is the same item. Well after 45 minutes of ignoring our concerns, finally she let us know that the food runner had brought our 3 meals to another table over half an hour ago. Right.... So now we need to board a flight, they quickly make us our meals, it comes out under cooked, we have a few bites before running to board, we get the bill and the 3 of us have our meals 10% compt. 10 freaking percent?!!! You have got to be kidding me Matt's! That is so unacceptable for a 45 minute wait, major screw up and then undercooked food that comes out and the 3 of us ate less then a quarter of. Not impressed.

ldf2hc9-yzHXAPsPl2kKQA.text: Stopped in 1st time and was very impressed. Seats were open at the bar and we ordered the omlet and BLT. Both came with side of hash browns which were amazing! My omlet was huge and I wish I had ordered cheddar but ordered provalone instead. I could only finish half due to the amount of food. The sourdough toast was awesome as well with the fresh made jam/jelly. Service was great. Highly recommended. They have lunch items as well.

KmUpTOM_v71ok23ugW5Rww.text: Friendly service and fresh food.  Both are usually hard to find at an airport. We enjoyed our breakfast very much.  They make homemade bread.

-t-yAa0rQWeVBXUyYh6RxQ.text: Horrible. Really only wanted a bite and cocktail waiting on delayed flight. How hard is NO Butter on toast? Sent it back 3x and it was never returned correctly. This was a side no less. One scrambled egg and dry rye fiasco. If that wasn't enough, she swooped my drink away with 2 sips left.

VHoEo_dneK4DSUis3ccpcA.text: I had eaten at MBB downtown once and was a fan of the food they served there. I really am behind the city's initiative to encourage local successful restaurants to open up locations in Sky Harbor airport, and Matt's Big Breakfast is a treat! They also have Lolo's Chicken n' Waffles, Deluxe Burger and Chelsea's Open Kitchen to name a few local fav spots that we frequent in town and at PHX. MBB is precisely what it sounds like Big Breakfasts. Keep in mind, it is located at Terminal 4 AFTER YOU CLEAR SECURITY.  Whatever tickles your first meal of the day fancy can be tickled deeply and thoroughly here. The menu is a True journey through morning comfort food presented in more bountiful and gourmet style that your regular combo #6 at your local slop n' drop diner. Last time I ate there before a flight I had a massive omelette with rosemary potatoes (which are amazing btw). My wife had poached eggs and off the bone ham which seemed to have come right from the farm! The only caution I would give is to make sure you have time to have a sit-down-and-order mea. The service is pretty fast but the clients come in waves and everyone seems to need to catch the same flight. l had to chase down our server to run my card as it seemed everyone in the place was trying to pay at once and were likely mostly on the same flight so be sure you're not in a photo-finish situation to your gate. For those in a rush, I think they also have a walk-up counter and sling breakfast sammies to go for those wanting to stink up economy class with their brought-on food...a practice I abhor. I never bring hot food onto a plane. It's rude. Bring a cold sandwich or a salad and leave your stinky McRaunchy's or Blazing burritos in the terminal! MBB...come hungry and then enjoy your post breakfast drooling coma as you soar the clear blue skies!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Best Bloody Mary ever! Meal in a glass.

ZExORL5PDTv9uja1UiwEcQ.text: Food isn't bad for an airport restaurant. Service is HORRIBLE!  No teamwork, tons of servers, but no structure, people grouped up talking, I would say it's horribly managed..... waited 30 minutes for a BLT with chips. Never once checked on my drinks or came by to inform me of the hold up. Do yourself a favor and keep walking......

N-VGXqV4LAQI8znbgtqzbg.text: (The opening times on Yelp aren't correct)  Decent burger - decent beer, decent service 3.5 stars rounded up to 4 stars.

Tsdibq4J2-OXlO5KsZq5_Q.text: Had an extended layover in PHX airport and decided to try this place out. I had forgotten that Guy Fieri highlighted the downtown spot on DDD.  Local coffee served from Roastery of Cave Creek. The panda needed that caffeine.  Five Spot Platter ($8.95): Breakfast sandwich with bacon, American cheese, two eggs, and grilled onions. Potatoes on the side. The roll is large, with a small layer of filler. On the plus side, the roll was soft and fluffy. The roll's flavor reminded me of a croissant. The potatoes were seasoned generously with salt and pepper. Bacon was excellent. Good portion. Overall, I'd say The Five Spot hit the spot.  I just sat at the bar for this one. Good service.  I saw others at the bar ordering Reubens. Hefty sandwiches that are recommended by the staff if you want a nice-sized lunch.  I'll have to remember this place next time, should I opt for a very gluttonous meal.

v6XKHp57So3y5aEaJ_hOCA.text: Service sucks sooooooo bad. I waited 25 minutes for a bowl of chili? Really? Did they have to hunt a cow? I mean you scoop it in a bowl and you serve it. It should only take 5 minutes but 25 minutes???? I walked out. Oh and by the way I told my waitress I've been waiting for 25 minutes---- she said ok. No apologies. Wow! Avoid it like a plague.

bKjvh8vygNhNIDLN8wNqMA.text: First review ever about an airport restaurant as they are usually mediocre at best.  But just had best airport breakfast ever with perfectly cooked over easy eggs, thick cut bacon, home fries cooked with onion and rosemary, and a nutty home grain toast with fresh raspberry jam, and locally roasted coffee and fresh squeezed orange juice.  The service was quick and the waiter was friendly and unhurried; he even brought me a large go cup of coffee gratis.  The restaurant was like an oasis in the desert after suffering all the indignities of PHX TSA. I will definitely be back.

A8zH_-FtANyL11AmnlDsOQ.text: Everyone says they really like this place. I have to say it was good. Especially for being in the airport it was a nice change from the usual. We had a long flight in front of us so I wanted to eat a real meal. So we went to Matts. We had a small bit of a wait. They were packed very popular place. We were seated and quickly served. Our server was great! She was fast, refilled out drinks and even brought us a to go box. Sorry to say I do not remember her name. as this was before we went on vacation. A lot has happened since then. The food was good but, not great. I got the pancakes that I ordered with my meal when I was almost through with my breakfast.  I realize they are very busy. It was decent. I would go back. Maybe when I am not so rushed. The price is a bit high I think. But, it is the Airport and rents are high there.  I will give it a go another time. Coffee was good. Service was great , food was so so.

DRuNyY4WBJPNuTWWVwOqPg.text: I will go 3 stars instead of 2 because it is in an airport. I sat down and was greeted by an unhappy, unhelpful bartender. I ordered food right away. After 25 minutes I asked her very politely to check on my food, as I had a plane to catch. She snapped back that the kitchen got busy. I told her I was not upset, I just had to get going. She went on to snap back that everything is made fresh so it takes time. I got a medium rare burger. Shouldn't take 25 minutes in an airport. When I did get my burger it was less than mediocre. I love burgers, it is hard for me to be unhappy with one, especially when it is supposedly cooled in butter. Meh.  I normally fly out of concourse A, I wss really excited to be in B to try this place. Next time, I will take a walk to another concourse. I won't be back here.

yOl6pB0LhUZVqsiYRdjfKg.text: Top notch food and service, done quickly and with a good understanding attitude. My BLT was fresh, with tomatoes that tasted like tomatoes should and fresh crisp lettuce on some great bread.  My buddy had a breakfast that was also fresh, plentiful and delicious. There's an amazing amount of good food in the Phoenix airport, yet this stands out for both great food and service.

eZezZY8_UA5OWvaCGc4EpA.text: Not my cup of tea. Very sweet Rosemary potatoes, prefer garlic and green peppers. Salami scramble, unempressive. Rubbery salami and tasteless eggs. Cold coffee.  Healthy food? I would loose weight by eating a lot less, if this was my only choice.

LltrIyjaNMwE_aCaAkKbRw.text: I've always had a great experience with the location on Phoenix, but I have not enjoyed my visit to this location once. The first time I got a breakfast burrito, and while it was good, there were so many jalapenos on it I almost got sick. The second time I ordered a burrito with no jalapenos, but they were still included on my burrito. The service at the to go counter isn't great, if you're going to eat here take the time to sit down for a meal.

_qI8QUIn0jOE7g1hIZIRcw.text: Ordered a Cheese Omelet to go. After 35 min. went to counter to inquire how much longer. Cashiers came back saying she didn't know what happened to order. I requested a refund as I was going to be late for flight. Manager showed up 8 minutes later, to inform me she had to issue refund through my e-mail. No apology was given and still have not received a refund!

yE6U4bphe6u4K9mI8X2EIQ.text: Matt's Big Breakfast is quite an institution in Phoenix, absolutely the place to go for breakfast. It's great to see the same quality, efficiency and competent wait staff replicated at the airport here. The three point breakfast made for a great lunch, waitress Toni was attentive and helpful, service was quick and the food very solid, not fancy, but tasty and nourishing. Fresh avocados rounded out a two eggs with meat sandwich and rosemary tomatoes. Airport food in general has come such a long way, but Matt's stands out.

6czZrHxwty_urEvcg4vnFg.text: I'm not sure what all the hype was about. My server was friendly and cheerful. The dining area was clean, but it was also 7 am so it shouldn't be too dirty. As far as food, eh.   I've been wanting to try the location in downtown but there's always a long wait. So when I saw Matts Big Breakfast at the airport, I had to try it. I definitely will not go to the downtown location now. It's not worth waiting in line or going out of my way. It's great for anyone who wants lots of food for a reasonable price, especially at the airport. But taste wise, you're better off going to Dennys. Meaning, don't come here looking for good tasting food. There are plenty of great local restaurants in terminal 4.   I'm giving this place 3 starts because the service was good, location is good, and the place was clean.

z7YGr3i9-0574dN-_rKwsQ.text: Really happy to find this place the morning of my flight home from Phoenix.  The servers are super cool - fun & cheery which is just what a weary traveler needs.  The couple sitting next to me were totally cracking up at their server - I had a different server but he was fun and attentive as well.    I had the breakfast burrito (vegetarian) and it was delish!   Coffee and water were kept full and the burrito was sooo good.    I'd definitely recommend.

FI_qcwELJie8D3KLUujYrQ.text: Matt's is definitely a go to food place while traveling through sky harbor!  I travel a lot for work and I am always flying out of sky harbor airport, when I do I usually always stop by Matt's. They have a variety of stuff to choose from, everything from breakfast to burgers as well as some great sandwiches. You get a lot of bang for your buck as well, most places in the airport are super expensive and you don't get a lot of food. Matt's gives you great size portions! They are also very quick so if you are in a hurry but don't want to eat fast food, Matt's will get you in and out in a hurry.

Xhq66z6evGwkc4DK4W2-8Q.text: Good thing we had a long layover..... Potatoes only tasted like rosemary. Bacon wasn't salty but thick. Bread was great. Over easy eggs were dry.   Seating for 2 are so close to your neighbors that I saw a heavy set guy walk away from the place.   Even regular sized customers were way too close together. A shot of Baileys for your coffee was $12.00 and they had no idea what a side of red was..... I don't frequent Phoenix but if I did, I wouldn't go back.

7k5oowuF5FMtq21OCZqnxQ.text: I have no idea why this place is so popular? How do they have three locations?  These questions boggle my mind.  We ordered the bloody mary after seeing a picture on yelp.  I am always looking for bloodies with fun garnishes.  This one looked fun!  Every garnish was meh.  The cheese seemed like it was going bad, the olives were drying out and the pickle was the worst pickle probably in the history of pickling.  I love pickles! How does one make a mediocre pickle?  I did not think it was possible.  The best garnish was the celery LOL.  Oh, and the bacon was so yuck!  Moving on to the bloody mary.  Nothing special at all.  I ordered a veggie omelette with cheddar.  It was good.  I have had better omelettes.  It wasn't fluffy and the veggies were somewhat greasy.  My sweets had a burger and said it was overcooked and there was nothing special about it.  Like I said, I have no clue what is so special about this place.  All in all don't eat here expecting a fresh over the top delish breakfast.  Expect average truck stop food pretending to be something worth talking about.

bB-IMRywwk74c0hgknkPbw.text: I almost like this better than the downtown location just based on size alone. But both locations tend to execute quickly and provide tasty food. They also have the best bacon, most deliciously seasoned potatoes, and garagantuously trimmed $14 bacon Bloody Mary's (for airport food, I'll take it). Their sourdough toast with housemade jam is also not to be missed.  Worth the treck to the B gates if you have the time before takeoff.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bacon Bloody ($14 but worth it in airport currency)

aH_ZVUajR_Pm6v0FUMN79w.text: It is extremely hard to find good airport food, especially with great service to boot.  This place had the best breakfast I have ever had in an airport.  Coffee was fabulous.  I have to give a shot out to the incredible service I received from Michael.  He was bullied by a customer and treated horrible, but kept a smile on his face and a spring in his step.  Way to go Michael!

-rREG47DZC7zc1m_YWcBaQ.text: Phoenix airport spot. Meatloaf, mashed potatoes and gravy.  Strong showing. Meatloaf was very dense, like it a little more moist typically. Flavor lacked a bit but the extra side of gravy. The Mrs has grilled cheese and tomato soup. Loved it but richhhhh. Best part was our server Dez. She rocked it. Definitely made the meal and the place.

fLEUGrA8brld8rUw1A9BVA.text: Had a meeting this morning in Phoenix landed at the Skyharbor Airport. Tip on traveling coast to coast, eat before flying. I was scared to eat that I might be going to the bathroom during the flight. Lucky, I had water and some crackers to fill me for my flight. Once I landed I headed over to MBB for the chop & chick with OJ and homefries. A splendid meal well cooked and the eggs were fresh. Their menu caters to most fans but I can't wait to go home tomorrow and try their other selections. Fresh and tender the chop and fries.

_jCsdhuM-qv39dMc0mOtLA.text: Food was great! First time trying out their breakfast food here. I got "The Hog and Chick" and it was fantastic & delicious! It was so packed when we got there and right when we sat down, it slowed down. Service was good even though she needed to smile more lol but it's fine. The food came at the expected time which is great. I liked it!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Tppqn1rFJr_EDr4ALaEiKQ.text: My co-worker and I ate here before boarding a flight.  It was packed with people and for a good reason. The food was worth the wait and cost. Which really wasn't bad for an airport. Our food came out fast and fresh. No waiting for slow service. These people have it together. Both of our dishes were very tasty. We each had Matt's Biggest Breakfast. My eggs were perfect and I'm hard to please. I could have eaten more and wished I did, since it was a wait for dinner as we missed lunch traveling.  The coffee was great by the way.

1bGvgFO1Zb7po_uJFB8VSg.text: Fries cold and mushy, stale pickles and my bacon was cold. Saw two other give their plates back full of food as well. I would avoid this place and go somewhere else in the airport, not worth the money

iNDGDMCc4YOpnNmwZo82Ug.text: Staff was friendly. Food was awful. We ordered The Skinny (4 egg whites w/gruyere cheese and chicken sausage). It was bad enough that there was more cheese than eggs but what made it inedible was that they also put spring greens on the plate covered in a vinaigrette. The smell was absolutely off putting and nauseating. I don't know if it was just the smell of the vinaigrette or it just didn't blend well with the strong gruyere. Either way the smell made It 100% an appetite killer. Other menu items might be very good but I have not tried them. I sent this back and had no appetite for anything else.  The manger did remove them from the bill, which is expected since we didn't eat any of it, but still charged us for coffee and a juice ($9.75) even after asking what they could do to make it right. Go figure.

oUsXktom3LBNxtYm-1KPuA.text: Tasty, well priced with pleasant and quick service.  Matt's uses the best ingredients and it makes a difference.  Portions are very healthy.

giY9CRTeUoAQBn6S-NAShQ.text: Have always wanted to hit this place in Phoenix.... wait, now they are in the Terminal at Sky Harbor Airport... baaam hellllooo layover.  Food was solid, had a name your omelet with sausage, veggies and some queso.  Potatoes had incredibly flavor with the seasonings and little extra they throw in there.  Service was great, my coffee cup was always full.  Definitely the right spot when stuck in Sky Harbor which seems to be EVERY time lately while they work on the runway.

zZbJ7dpr6HyIqwTZSyV92w.text: I don't normally think of food at the airport as a great place to have breakfast. However, I have been proved wrong this morning.  What a little surprise in the middle of the airport. This place is taking breakfast seriously. I don't feel I am being given sub par food for an exorbitant amount of money. If this was a restaurant anywhere else, I would go back again.  Our servers name was Matthew. Although they are very busy, and I can see why, he is a great waiter and very attentive. Awesome service and a True professional.   I must say that the bacon is awesome. Nice big piece of meat very peppery.  The porkchops were amazing as well. The art of cooking eggs is not over looked here. They know the difference between an over medium and an over easy egg.  Would you like toast with your breakfast, don't expect the generic toast that you get in every restaurant across America. Beautiful thick slices of great read. The sourdough bread was absolutely amazing, and I'm from the San Francisco area.The raspberry preserves were amazing and tasted house made.   My hats are off to the manager and the staff at this restaurant. Job very well done. We are very pleased!!!

sddpNF_1JB5lotQPz6ESzA.text: I'm a huge fan of the original location downtown and I appreciate the location in terminal 4. The bar appears to be well stocked and staff are friendly. Your coffee cup will never be empty.

xQQjibUZC7lifxw7PuS40A.text: Absolutely the best place to stop by for food when in the PHX airport - perhaps the only place to get a decent meal! I ordered a salad to go. The woman behind the counter was super kind to me in talking to me about the different food options they have, as well as getting me a menu to order something directly from the kitchen. I ordered Tossed Cobb and waited a few minutes for it to get prepared. I realized two minutes later that the salad was already available in the refrigerated section, but the woman insisted that I order a freshly-made salad. And it was delectable! Warm chicken on top of crisp vegetables, and enormous - this is the kind of salad I want for $10. Next time, I'll try the True breakfast items that this place is known for.

scIDm29i3bm40vcWfsSC1Q.text: 1/8 of a star but it's not an option this picture should tell you why and not to mention the server told me that he couldn't take my drink order because he had other tables he still need to get to.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

7_pneL9OvMh38rZx1LS9dA.text: My fiance and I stopped into here because there wasn't much to choose from at the Phoenix airport. We arrived around 7:30-8am and it was packed. We were seated fairly quickly though.   We were originally seated at the one of the tall tables and after sitting on a plane for over 5 hours, those chairs are so uncomfortable. A booth became available and we asked to be seated there and they let us. So I was thankful for that.   The food was pretty good. Just your regular breakfast options. We ordered Matt's big breakfast with an extra egg and toast to split. It comes with sausage, bacon, two eggs, home fries and a pancake. I enjoyed everything except the sausage, but my fiance liked it all. Home fries were flavored very well. Eggs were cooked perfectly. I also ordered a side of Mac Salad, which isn't normally available until 11:30, but they had it ready so they let me.  For the amount of people that were there and only 3 guys cooking, the food and time that it came out in was impressive. Our server was very friendly and she was very accommodating. We had a good experience here.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Eggs, home fries, bacon and sausage
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mac salad
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pancake

dGkoxBIMtdqaxmuFlK7weQ.text: The food was just ok. Service was very slow for takeout. Most annoyingly, all of the prices have been (poorly) crossed out with a black marker. I was shocked to find that my breakfast sandwich cost about 50% more than previous price. If you're going to hike up the prices so ridiculously high, the least you could do is buy a new sign with correct prices.

qfXlhkGw86iZOEiOA2VcBg.text: Waited 30 minutesfor a burrito I had to leave without. Don't advertise a take away counter if you can't get food out in less than half an hour

Y3-Xn_xVQSDkTfksMA6k-Q.text: I ordered the Hog and Chick meal from the take away counter and specifically said I wanted my eggs cooked without cheese. When I opened up the box at my gate I discovered the eggs had cheese, and the bacon, potatoes, and toast were all burnt. I was able to eat some of the potatoes and toast, but the bacon was basically charcoal.

-zlC_IQqFnc_CAjyWfE8wA.text: So I had been wanting to try this place. But, I have always been in such a hurry when I am at the airport I had not had time. The plus side is ,it is inside security so you don't have to worry about getting through Security. Which can always be stressful. It is a very popular place as it is on the low B gates and there is a lot of flights out of that side in the morning. I came here with a friend from Denver after coming in from a flight. So we were not rushed. It is a very clean looking place. A great menu to choose from as well.  I ordered the Steak and Eggs, just a note, they do not do poached. So I got scrambled. It was very good and the steak was cooked just the way I like it. My friend got potatoes ,eggs , and bacon. The food was delicious and cooked just right. It was hot when it came out and it came out fast. The only thing that makes me give it 4 stars instead of 5. Was our server. She never brought us more coffee.  Seriously we had to ask 2 other servers for more coffee. Which they brought us and with a smile.  Our server Alexa( I think that was her name). Did not seem too happy to be there and did not want us to have more than one cup of coffee.  The bright side is, Food is great, place is clean, and most all the other servers are awesome.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Eggs, bacon, potatoes, and it comes with toast
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Steak and eggs ,a great choice

2seKI93wWPjv2aYhySeMCQ.text: We ended up here after our late evening layover flight dropped us off.  We had an hour and a half to kill, so we wandered about the Phoenix Sky Harbor airport unsure what eatery or drinkery to patronize.  Many places were somewhat busy, but Matt's Big Breakfast was spacious enough to draw our attention.  Even though Matt's advertises breakfast, they have a full bar also!  This was our first official day of vacation and decided to celebrate with a cocktail. We found room at the bar and ordered drinks.  I got a Patron Tequila Sunrise, while Joe K ordered a Captain Morgan rum & coke.  They actually offer you choices of premium brand liquors.  Our beverages came in ample sized glasses and they really hit the spot, quenched our thirsts and gave us a mellowing buzz.  Joe was not feeling well and was having a hard time relaxing, so the cocktails were a welcome availability.  Even though our drinks cost $14.00 each, it was a nice splurge that we don't often indulge in.   As for the food, I can't form an opinion on, but other patrons received some delicious looking meals.  And yes, those breakfasts were quite big!  If we were hungry and had more time, I would have definitely tried out their breakfast!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Restaurant sign
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Rum &amp; Coke
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tequila Sunrise

JzCHX7F0ZsKAbLPKhy5ZQw.text: MATT'S BIG ATTITUDES! Avoid the bar. There are many other bars in terminal 4 for some reason this bar you are dirt under their feet. Hot beer on tap and cold attitudes.  I travel thru phx airport 42 weeks a year. Eaten here many times. Wasn't till tonight when i met Melissa the bar tender i was compelled to write about it. Avoid her. Mean as s snake.

BaV3mGQa5-wjLFsri_0I8w.text: Food fair @ best. Got the BLT which was on dry toast & over done bacon- Cole slaw was an upgrade dont bother! Dry cabbage is what you get- Tomato soup is pretty good tho it takes an act of Congress to get some oyster crackers to go with it. Customer Service sucks! Had to go up to the bar to get a soda refill not once but twice & to ask for crackers- Waiter no where around- this is the 2nd time we tried this place with the same terrible customer service- don't waste your time- there are plenty of other good places in the terminal to get a good meal with good customer service!

sV66suO7Wp5d-iycWQPJWA.text: Really good airport food. I've eaten here a few times since it has a great location amongst the American Airlines gates. They have pretty great food and the only comment I have is that the service is spotty. Overall I've had good service but the last few visits the tables around me have gotten their food first, even if it was the same as my order. All in all I will definitely go back, but don't stop to eat in if you have less than an hour to spend.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Burrito
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Breakfast sandwich

NejJwWVNUdBJoujZ_qLZHQ.text: OMG...what a fun place to eat breakfast. A rainbow cast serves up some pretty good breakfast. The place put a smile on my face.

1vyYA1ho1Hl_U9o7dqgzaQ.text: Let's start with the horrible service from the cashier.  I have been to the establishment twice and this is my last time here. The service is horrific, I asked a simple question of what came with the tuna salad sandwich and the cashier handed me the menu and basically called me an idiot. First of all if you are taking the orders you should know that when a customer is in need of an answer a simple explanation will suffice instead of being completely irrational.  I understand the service industry and as a business owner, I know the level service that needs to be given.  I'm utterly disappointed in this place and lack of knowledge thereof,  it's very unfortunate

xhuIwPUNSKC1yMjJn2VTmw.text: If you want to wait in line for 15 min (when there is only 4 people in line) and then wait another 15 min for a breakfast burrito. Eat here. Also, it was $20 for a burrito and a water. You suck Matt.

-W2ish8BUIzJESzfa09Lkw.text: My Uber driver advised I try this place before I left Phoenix, so I took the recommendation. It was more crowded than I expected but all good places are. I waited for the hostess to take my name down but he kept acting like people weren't standing and staring at him to say hello. After a few times of this a waiter spoke to everyone which saved me from walking away. The hostess still hadn't said a word so I did and just decided to sit at the bar since something was available. I ordered the French Toast an egg and a Mimosa. So GOOD!!! The ladies at the bar were quick and pleasant, made sure everyone was served and would check back frequently. Everyone else and the food made up for the flustered hostess. Glad I got to visit, I'm sure I will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

WSLnGpdW1PsJRz0L15hQdg.text: I had about an hour layover in Phoenix and decided to stop here for breakfast. There was a decent line of people waiting to be seated, so I thought it must be worth the wait. There wasn't a host/hostess on duty, so people were cutting in line to get seated before others who had been waiting longer. Anyways, I finally sat down and ordered a cheese omelette and added bacon and sausage. The omelette comes out, and it's a little lukewarm. Ok fine. Then a couple bites into the omelette, I see a mushroom. Hmm. Maybe it just snuck in. Nope. I peeled back the omelette and saw a ton of mushrooms. I really dislike mushrooms. If this omelette is supposed to come with mushrooms, list them as an ingredient on the menu! The menu literally said your choice of cheese and that's it. No mention of mushrooms. Unpleasant surprise for sure. The potatoes were cold too. It was a disappointing breakfast to say the least, but the service was good.

yfHZou2tduHEgkpm7yZFtg.text: We came into the place starving and ready to devour our food. But the trouble had started with getting seated and having to fight with a father and a little girl for our seats because they thought they were sitting there even though they never got seated by anyone. After that we ordered and ended up waiting 20 minutes for our food. I ordered the 5 platter plate (breakfast sandwich), it was really good. My cousin ordered a omelet and loved it. My sister ordered the salami scramble and it wasn't good, I could make better eggs. My brother ordered the big breakfast and ate it fast.The only thing that we hated was the potatoes. The potatoes in general were fine but they were sauteed in rosemary or something foul and were just nasty. The food was decently priced and you get what you pay for. Wouldn't recommend for a quick meal. Nothing special.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Matts big breakfast
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Griddle

xbjSWwCqVSTVmhB3xb1_cw.text: If you enjoy fruit flies swarming around your beverage, having your meal given to the table next to you (and eaten before they discovered the problem), slow service, then THIS is YOUR place!  Hopefully I Will not get sick from the flies in my beverage!!!   Guess I will need to wait for the next 48 to 72 hours to see if I get sick.   I expect this in a foreign country or open air restaurant but not at an airport!

ODz4wReEzCs9ZNPg-M6q_Q.text: To preface this: I actually really enjoy Matt's Big Breakfast - the food tends to be great quality, and service is fine. I just do not like the customer service at THIS Matt's (at the airport).  Tl;dr - poor customer service will cost you (both reputation and cash).  My wife and I gave our name to the host (who was this older, very curt fellow) and moved about 4 feet away from the entrance to make space for others to pass through and/or add themselves to the waiting list. The host told us it would be about 15-20 minutes but hopefully faster.  My wife and I then started having a conversation off to the side while still listening for our name to be called. Meanwhile there was a really outgoing waiter who was very personable serving people just on the other side of the barrier we were standing by.  As we are standing there, I spot about 5 groups get called in, so I figure we are getting close. It's been about 12 minutes at this point. I go to check the list, and there's a lot more names crossed off the list AFTER us. I mean about 15 names scratched off AFTER us. No way we heard him call that many names for people. It honestly just looked like he was arbitrarily crossing people off the list. And indeed our name was crossed off, but I decided to double check with him anyway.  I ask the host if he called our name (I swear he did not), and he said he did but we did not respond. His tone was incredibly rude, too - like he was gloating about it. We were literally 4 feet from his stand. What?  At this point, I realize it might have been possible that we missed our name being called as the outgoing waiter was really loud, but please, if you see us 4 feet away, just call it again to make sure. Better yet - switch the host and the waiter. No way would we have missed his call. The original host was mumbling by comparison, and he looked like he hated being a host.  The best the host offered was to put us back on the list, but at that point, I had no faith in his ability to be courteous or to call our names when our turn was up, so we just left. Your time is better spent at an establishment that will at least try (and not just rest on the laurels of being a known restaurant).

5z5E3LPuHOkwxH-e39kRmw.text: Ive always wanted to try Matt's BB at the airport..... Even though this is the only Matts that serves alcohol, it  doesn't compare. Stay with the original location, even the food portion was different.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. I think i got cheated out of my home fries order

Us7_-djQBx03Tj7U22pz3g.text: The staff was nice enough ... offered me soda water v Diet Dr. Pepper which they don't have. They offered me jalapenos and guacamole on my chili. All very nice. When I got my bill, I found that they charged me $3.59 for soda water and $5 for jalapenos and guacamole. I have no issue paying ... I just would have appreciated a heads up that they were about to rip me off.   If you don't like nasty surprises, don't eat here. Buyer beware!!!

b9Il3c-rDqQTW_lHHYfH-Q.text: I never do one star reviews, I leave that to other  folks however I have to keep it on the realz. Absolutely the worst customer service I have ever experienced not once but twice.  Had to drop my kiddo off at the airport super duper early today. I always wait at the gate with her. I grabbed my usual coffee from the Refuge and they are always awesome! Decided to grab a sandwich to go from this place and walked up to the "to go" counter and the waitress who was prepping said and I quote "I have to check to see if we are open" and walked away. The gentlemen who was in line with me said they open @ 5:30 (it was 5:30) so they are open. There were 6 people working, bartender, host, cook, mgr and a couple other people. Why comeeeee the waitress never came back, no one acknowledged the growing line of folks waiting to order. I walked over to the bartender who was actually taking food orders for the folks who sat at the bar and politely asked if someone was going to take our orders and she said without one glance that the waitress will be over in a min. Mind you we had been standing there for 7 mins, every single person that worked there looked over at the ever growing to go line. I/we watched the waitress go get water for a table, coffee then slowly walk to get a coke! Reallyyyy folks... really! After almost 10 mins I was like let's bounce. As I walked by the waitress was taking the food order of the one table she had. Everyone else was sitting at the bar! Still not one person working there went over to the "to go" line.   How very very rude. This  place needs to get it the heck together and revisit their customer service etiquette. The shift manager was there too! Wow just wow.    Done and done....never again!

PTHhGhYXgUs6Xil1Si9WMw.text: Had a layover in Phoenix 6:50 am, decided to get breakfast while waiting for our next flight. Staff was nice and friendly, hubby and I ordered the skinny, thought a nice light breakfast would be good. It was 4 egg whites with gruyere cheese, chicken apple sausage and spinach. What we didn't expect was the spring greens that came with it with a very strong smelling wine vinaigrette. The eggs were practically swimming in it. The eggs had so much cheese in it, the smell of it paired with the vinaigrette was very off putting it turned our stomach so much so early in the morning that we couldn't even think of ordering anything else. Manager apologized and said whatever we can do, we'll do it. We still got charged $10 for a small cup of coffee and small glass of orange juice :(.

xCxyff0_kXduyScgt_nN4g.text: Breakfast done right.. Bacon  and Sausage crafted just for Matt's take me back to Times my grandfather raised his pigs butchered and made his own .. the pancakes are good, the eggs free range , home fries scratch made. I prefer hash browns but the home fries are good, the service fast and friendly.. best breakfast in an airport I have found..

-wkFMzvRbQPDsuMOxjNi2g.text: My server (Miguel) was super awesome, right on point with everything, quick, friendly, and attentive. I ordered a Fancy Salad. The plate arrived greasy which was weird because a salad with chicken shouldn't be greasy. The manager came out and apologized immediately. They built another fresh salad.   While it wasn't a perfect experience, the staff made up for it in friendliness and caring.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fancy Salad

hCKhOq_WhFSMFN914MGnXA.text: Dang this place was good! Before traveling, my SO and I stopped here to eat since we had time and I was not disappointed. The hostess was a bit dry, bored, and wrung out but the rest of the staff was very welcoming and friendly so I won't let her influence my opinion. This place seems like the spot that would be packed all of the time, so expect to be rubbing elbows with a stranger while you eat. Aside from this, the food was great! I got their grilled cheese and french fries which were fantastic, they use a really thick bread which made the sandwich even better. I would definitely come here again...if I'm ever delayed and forced to fly Southwest again -_____-

mYdo43ORwGN8K8IIXAGJMQ.text: Great place to eat at the airport. Try the reuben very tasty. Friendly staff and they are quick.

PfzOQ4M7VGrlRtGBW7oCkQ.text: Their coffee was bad, the service was slow (they forgot my order) and they don't have half and half! Seriously, it can't be that hard to find a local source for cream.

wSlitwPr8Cn-hU2ycjzwkQ.text: Stopped in with my wife for breakfast before boarding our flight. It's a small place so expect to wait sometimes when they are busy about 30 min. So I recommend planning ahead to arrive at the airport early so you get to try this amazing food.  The pancake was amazing nice and fluffy with just the right amount of very subtle crispiness. What else can I say about BACON!!! BACON ROCKS and the bacon here is a little thick, crispy, and very tasty! The home fries are seasoned and cooked with friend onions so if you don't like onions might want to let them know.   Our server was Tim and he was AWESOME. Great personality, friendly, and just a cool guy.  Highly recommend visiting this great place!
